item.title: Evan add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Younger citizens of the town do not know him at all save as a tall, apparently strong and healthy man who loafs in a brooding, saturnine fashion wherever he will be allowed, never exactly accepted by any group." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Evan add a quote by Kurt Cobain
item.description: "I have very bad posture." -- Kurt Cobain

item.title: Evan add a quote by Don Delillo
item.description: "He speaks in your voice, American, and there's a shine in his eye that's halfway hopeful." -- Don Delillo

item.title: Evan add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "The Duke [John Wayne] was a massive figure. He looked like a heavy piece of hauled lumber, and it didn't seem like any man could stand shoulder to shoulder with him." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Evan add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "I'm the oldest son of a crazy man, I'm in a cowboy band." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Evan add a quote by Indiana Jones
item.description: "Mola Ram, prepare to meet Kali - in Hell!" -- Indiana Jones

item.title: Evan add a quote by Shelby Foote
item.description: "North was only a direction indicated by a compass--if a man had one, that is, for otherwise there was no north or south or east or west; there was only the brooding desolation." -- Shelby Foote

item.title: Evan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "But, mate, my heart is sore for Christian diet. You mightn't happen to have a piece of cheese about you, now? No? Well, many's the long night I've dreamed of cheese--toasted, mostly--and woke up again, and here I were." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Evan add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "It's the same with men as with horses and dogs, nothing wants to die." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Evan add a quote by Billy Joe Shaver
item.description: "You been to school, you say you are a lawyer, you walked out of a magazine. I've been a drifter and a low-life loser, you can learn a lot from me." -- Billy Joe Shaver

item.title: Evan add a quote by Hunter Thompson
item.description: "The trade is meaningless. It is like trading a used mattress for a $300 bill." -- Hunter Thompson

item.title: Evan add a quote by Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
item.description: "Work is what horses die of" -- Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

item.title: Evan add a quote by Roger Miller
item.description: "Roses are red and violets are purple, sugar is sweet and so is maple surple." -- Roger Miller

item.title: Evan add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "It is like sitting in a traffic jam on the San Diego Freeway with your windows rolled up and Portuguese music booming out of the surround-sound speakers while animals gnaw on your neck and diseased bill collectors hammer on your doors with golf clubs." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Evan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "All the best matadors were Fascists." -- George Orwell

item.title: Evan add a quote by Henry Louis Gates
item.description: "Conspiracy theories are an irresistible labor-saving device in the face of complexity." -- Henry Louis Gates

item.title: Evan add a quote by Sam Lipsyte
item.description: "This country was built on the backs of dudes who drank on buses. What we do honors them." -- Sam Lipsyte

item.title: Evan add a quote by Daniel Woodrell
item.description: "So much death and no coffee to be had." -- Daniel Woodrell
